title: Filip Turek, the Czech Trumpist 'Motorist' who flirts with Nazi symbols
subhead: 'The new faces of the far right' (2/5) The honorary president of the Motorist Party, which won nearly 7% of the vote in the legislative elections, is seeking the position of foreign minister in Andrej Babis's government.

title: Louvre heist: Who were the royals the stolen jewels belonged to?
subhead: Eight extremely valuable items were stolen on Sunday morning from the Apollo Gallery in the world's largest museum. Most of them belonged to Marie-Amélie of Bourbon-Siciles, Hortense de Beauharnais and Eugénie de Montijo.

title: 'The Gaza agreement is fragile, but the Americans are on top of it': Words of hope from an Israeli peace broker
subhead: Researcher and activist Gershon Baskin, who has been involved in ceasefire efforts in Gaza, rejects the Netanyahu government's claim that Hamas is reluctant to return the bodies of hostages who died in the enclave. He also argues that demilitarization is not out of reach.

title: Gerhard Richter on display at the Fondation Louis Vuitton
subhead: With 271 works − including rare loans − on display, this is the largest retrospective ever devoted to the German artist. It opens in Paris on October 17.

title: 'Nicolas Sarkozy's supporters have undermined the foundations of political and judicial life'
subhead: Philippe Conte, professor emeritus of criminal law at Panthéon-Assas University, says the judges who convicted the former French president of criminal conspiracy merely enforced the laws written by those now denouncing them.
